neighbors.name: Png Enterprises Inc
neighbors.claims: Png Enterprises, Inc. is a Pennsylvania corporation that owns commercial property within the Highridge Business Park in Cass Township ([source](https://cms8.revize.com/revize/schuylkillcountypa/Document_Center/Agenda%20&%20minutes/Planning%20Commission%20Meetings/2024/2024%2009%20Agenda%20Package.pdf)). The company is the recorded owner of the 'Highridge Park Service Plaza Lot 3,' which is associated with the Country Inn & Suites hotel located at the business park ([source](https://cms8.revize.com/revize/schuylkillcountypa/Document_Center/Agenda%20&%20minutes/Planning%20Commission%20Meetings/2024/2024%2009%20Agenda%20Package.pdf)). While the draft profile attributed the company to President Naran Patel, specific executive leadership for this corporate entity was not explicitly confirmed in the available public planning records, though the company is actively engaged in subdivision and land development applications within the county as of late 2024 ([source](https://cms8.revize.com/revize/schuylkillcountypa/Document_Center/Agenda%20&%20minutes/Planning%20Commission%20Meetings/2024/2024%2009%20Agenda%20Package.pdf)). No documented stance on renewable energy development was found in public hearing minutes or media.
neighbors.influence_justification: Commercial property owner operating within a designated business park; no evidence of broader community leadership or political involvement found.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach as a commercial neighbor focused on business continuity; emphasize that the project will not disrupt hotel/service plaza operations or access to Highridge Business Park.

citations.claim: Png Enterprises, Inc. is a Pennsylvania corporation that owns commercial property within the Highridge Business Park in Cass Township
citations.title: Schuylkill County Planning Commission Agenda Sept 2024

citations.claim: The company is the recorded owner of the 'Highridge Park Service Plaza Lot 3,' which is associated with the Country Inn & Suites hotel located at the business park
citations.title: Schuylkill County Planning Commission Agenda Sept 2024

citations.claim: company is actively engaged in subdivision and land development applications within the county as of late 2024
citations.title: Schuylkill County Planning Commission Agenda Sept 2024

neighbors.name: 611 Land Development LLC
neighbors.claims: 611 Land Development LLC is a Pennsylvania limited liability company that serves as a development entity for the Onvo network of travel plazas (formerly Liberty Travel Plazas) ([source](https://shensentinel.com/news/travel-plaza-progress-continuing-hotel-planned-next-door/)). Contrary to the draft's claim of limited local presence, the entity is the primary developer of a major commercial project in Cass Township (Schuylkill County): the Onvo Travel Plaza and an adjacent TownePlace Suites by Marriott at the Highridge Business Park ([source](https://shensentinel.com/news/travel-plaza-progress-continuing-hotel-planned-next-door/)). The company is affiliated with Onvo founders Sonny Singh and Andy Aulakh ([source](https://www.natso.com/liberty-travel-plazas-unveils-new-brand-name/)), and public records link the LLC to Great Bend Holdings Inc ([source](https://elementix.ai/investors/pa/aminderjeet-aulakh)). The entity has demonstrated a supportive stance toward energy infrastructure; its projects have received National Electric Vehicle Infrastructure (NEVI) funding to install EV charging stations at its locations, including the Pottsville/Highridge site ([source](https://www.nepa-alliance.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/DRAFT-NEPA-LRTP-2050-11.13.23-Public-Comment-Period.pdf)). In addition to the Schuylkill County project, the entity is actively developing hospitality properties in Monroe County (Bartonsville), where it has sought zoning variances for hotel construction ([source](https://irp.cdn-website.com/86533f4d/files/uploaded/4-21-25_BOC_Minutes.pdf)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Significant economic contributor as developer of a major travel plaza and hotel in the Highridge Business Park; recipient of state/federal infrastructure funding (NEVI).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage leadership (Singh/Aulakh family) or Great Bend Holdings representatives. Highlight potential synergies with their NEVI-funded EV charging infrastructure and the reliability benefits of the proposed renewable energy project for their hospitality operations.

citations.claim: 611 Land Development LLC is a Pennsylvania limited liability company that serves as a development entity for the Onvo network of travel plazas
citations.title: Travel plaza progress continuing; hotel planned next door

citations.claim: entity is the primary developer of a major commercial project in Cass Township (Schuylkill County): the Onvo Travel Plaza and an adjacent TownePlace Suites by Marriott
citations.title: Travel plaza progress continuing; hotel planned next door

citations.title: Liberty Travel Plazas Unveils New Brand Name: Onvo

citations.claim: public records link the LLC to Great Bend Holdings Inc
citations.title: Aminderjeet Aulakh Real Estate Investor Profile

citations.claim: projects have received National Electric Vehicle Infrastructure (NEVI) funding to install EV charging stations at its locations
citations.title: NEPA MPO 2050 Long-Range Transportation Plan

citations.title: Pocono Township Board of Commissioners Minutes

neighbors.name: Reading Anthracite Company
neighbors.claims: Reading Anthracite Company is a Pottsville-based coal mining and land management corporation, acquired by the Rich family in 1961 and currently led by President Brian Rich Sr. ([source](https://readinganthracite.com/)). It controls approximately 20,000 acres in the region, making it the area’s largest coal producer and a dominant landowner ([source](https://community.pasenategop.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/56/2022/10/anthracite.pdf)). The company has explicitly pivoted toward renewable energy development; General Counsel Jason Kelso testified to the PA Senate that the company is 'exploring opportunities to transform some of our former mine lands into alternative energy sites such as solar farms and wind turbine parks' ([source](https://community.pasenategop.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/56/2022/10/anthracite.pdf)). Specific renewable projects include the 'Glendower Solar Development' in Foster Township, which received conditional approval in 2025 ([source](https://www.fostertwp.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/January-6-2025.pdf)), and a 25-acre solar array approved in Schuylkill Township in 2023 ([source](https://www.tnonline.com/20231020/schuylkill-twp-approves-solar-panels-on-coal-land/)). Additionally, its sister company, JMB Limited, secured approval for a solar farm in West Mahanoy Township ([source](https://shensentinel.com/news/reading-anthracite-gets-first-solar-farm-approved/)). The company actively leverages its land portfolio for energy partnerships and reclamation-based development.
neighbors.influence_justification: Largest private landowner in the county; active developer of multiple solar projects; deep historical and economic ties to the region's industrial base.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage company leadership (Brian Rich Sr. or General Counsel Jason Kelso); frame the project as complementary to their existing 'Glendower' and Schuylkill Township solar portfolios. They are sophisticated energy developers and potential partners.

citations.claim: Reading Anthracite Company is a Pottsville-based coal mining and land management corporation, acquired by the Rich family in 1961 and currently led by President Brian Rich Sr.
